frame.name: Complaining
frame.definition:
<def-root>A <fen>Complainer</fen> communicates their negative emotional reaction to some state of affairs in a <fen>Complaint</fen>. As an alternative to the specific <fen>Complaint</fen>, the <fen>Topic</fen> of the speaker's <fen>Complaint</fen> may be specified.
<ex>The <fex name="Complainer">top US commander in Iraq</fex> <t>complained</t> <fex name="Add">to the Pentagon</fex> <fex name="Time">last winter</fex> <fex name="Complaint">that his supply situation was so poor that it threatened Army troops' ability to fight</fex>.</ex>
<ex>He said <fex name="Complainer">he</fex> will <m>lodge</m> a <t>complaint</t> <fex name="Add">with the ACCC</fex>. <fex name="Complaint">DNI</fex></ex>
<ex><fex name="Time">On the rare occasions</fex> <fex name="Complainer">I</fex> <t>complained</t> <fex name="Add">to him</fex> <fex name="Topic">about media bias</fex>, Peter immediately ordered up a story that included conservative objections to mainstream reports .</ex>
<ex></ex>
<asf>ASFALDA French FrameNet comment</asf>:
<ex> ≠ <frframe>FR_Judgment_communication</frframe>/<frframe>FR_Judgment_communication_no_reason</frframe>: The FR_Judgment_communication and FR_Judgment_communication_no_reason frames are about assessing and verbalizing the Evaluee's value as positive or negative, whereas Complaining is about expressing one's discontent with a state of affairs.</ex>
<ex> ≠ <frframe>FR_Taking_sides</frframe>: Complaining's LUs all imply that the Complainer verbally communicates their point of view whereas FR_Taking_sides' LUs do not. Moreover, Complaining's LUs all imply that the Complainer's point of view is negative whereas in FR_Taking_sides, the point of view can be either positive or negative. </ex>
<ex> ≠ <frframe>FR_Expressing_side</frframe>: Complaining's LUs polarity is always negative, and always implied by the LU itself, whereas FR_Expressing_side LUs can express either a positive or negative point of view, depending on the Polarity role filler which is expressed separately from the LU. </ex>
</def-root>

FE.name: Complainer
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Complainer</fen> is the sentient entity that produces the <fen>Complaint</fen> (whether spoken or written).
<ex><fex name="Complainer">Peter</fex> has <t>moaned</t> about it on another thread but it sure must be nice for him to wallow again.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Addressee
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Addressee</fen> is the person to whom the <fen>Complaint</fen> is communicated.
<ex>Fresh out of prison, Martin <t>whinged</t> <fex name="Add">to Sonia</fex> about his life.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Complaint
FE.definition:
<def-root>The lamentable situation that the <fen>Complainer</fen> is communicating to the <fen>Addressee</fen>.
<ex>One observer <t>groused</t> <fex name="com">that Skagway was "little better than hell on earth."</fex></ex></def-root>

FE.name: Topic
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Topic</fen> is the subject matter to which the <fen>Complaint</fen> pertains.
<ex>Ferdinand attended the reception at the city hall and <t>complained</t> vociferously <fex name="Topic">about his reception at the city</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Medium
FE.definition:
<def-root><fen>Medium</fen> is the physical entity or channel used by the <fen>Complainer</fen> to transmit the <fen>Complaint</fen>.
<ex>I don't mean to discount any of what he has <t>bitched</t> about <fex name="Medium">in his article</fex>, because most of his points are actually valid. </ex></def-root>
